metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10742 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Zabbix before 2.2.21rc1, 3.x before 3.0.13rc1, 3.1.x and 3.2.x before 3.2.10rc1, and 3.3.x and 3.4.x before 3.4.4rc1 allows open redirect via the request parameter. It was discovered that Zabbix incorrectly handled the request parameter. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to redirect requests to external links.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
